text: Interprofessional Education (IPE) Audra Xenakis, DNP, RN This Photo by Unknown author is licensed under CC BY-NC-ND. What is an IPE? "When 2 or more professional learn with, from, and about each other to improve collaboration and quality of care" (Guraya & Barr, 2018) This Photo by Unknown author is licensed under CC BY-NC-ND. Why is it important? Promotes interdisciplinary collaboration and teamwork Reduces barriers and preconceptions about healthcare groups Promotes professional competencies Improving the quality of patient care! What will my role be? • Either... • LVN at long-term care facility • Recorder at Emergency Room • Family member • Patient This Photo by Unknown author is licensed under CC BY-NC. Who else will I be training with? • Associate Degree Nursing Students • Emergency Medical Service Students • Respiratory Therapy Students • Faculty Video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aOHTDXWYhAk&t=6s Role: LVN • Head to Toe versus Focus Assessment • Contacting EMS • Signs of cardiac and respiratory distress • Recording Coding Events What is CHF? Assessing Pain Assessing pain "Do you have pain?" Location: "Where is your pain located?" Intensity: "On a scale of 0 to 10, 0 is no pain and 10 is the worse pain you have every felt, what is the scale of your pain?" Character frequency: "Can you describe your pain?" Duration: "How long have you had the pain?" Signs and Symptoms- Myocardial Infarction (Heart Attack) Team Dynamics During a CodeRecorderHow do I prepare? Wear uniform and have your clinical supplies Review CPR skills Review Focus and Head-to-Toe Assessments Prepare to be engaged Communication is KEY! Scope of Practice and Level of Learning • Medication Administration • Oxygen Therapy If you haven't been taught a skill... defer it to RN or EMS or RT • Obtain supplies as needed (syringes, needles, suction...) • Transferring of patient (wheelchair, stretcher...) Be active in event When and where do I go? When: • Tuesday, September 10th @ 0700 • Do not be late! • Begins at 0700...so be there earlier Where: Meet in Temple College Leopard Room (IPE will be conducted in HSC) Leopard Room What changes will occur to my schedule? Exam: 2:30-3:30 ▪ Orientation to clinical units: 2:30-3:30 ▪ Medication Administration: 3:30-6:30 ▪ Wrap up: 6:30-7:00 • A Dosage Calculation Exam will follow the IPE • The IPE is considered your Clinical Day for the week Reference • Guraya, S.
